alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 2:54PM MST until January 02 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Flagstaff AZ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arizona... Oak Creek near Cornville affecting Yavapai County. For Oak Creek...including Cornville, Sedona...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oak Creek near Cornville. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Flooding begins to inundate lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 8.0 feet, Flooding of lower terrace of RV park upstream of Page Springs Road Bridge. At 9.0 feet, Hiking trails along banks of creek affected. Portions of residential yards flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM MST Sunday the stage was 3.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to rise to flood stage around 9 PM tonight, with a maximum value of 9.3 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Oak Creek Cornvill 8.0 3.4 Sun 2 pm MST 8.5 3.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM MST.
